The Pay Our Troops Act of 2026 provides continuing appropriations for military pay and allowances—covering active-duty service members, including reserves, and DoD/Homeland Security civilian personnel and contractors—during a government shutdown, ensuring pay continues until the earlier of the enactment of full-year appropriations or the end of the shutdown period.

The bill is in the process of being considered by the House Appropriations Committee, where it was sponsored by Rep. Jennifer A. Kiggans (R-VA-2).

answers.1:
This bill, titled the *Continuing Appropriations and Extensions and Other Matters Act, 2026*, provides continuing appropriations for federal agencies through the earlier of October 31, 2025, or the enactment of the applicable appropriations act. It prevents a government shutdown by funding operations during the transition period before FY2026 appropriations are finalized. The bill also permanently extends the expanded premium tax credit for health insurance, provides additional funding for Medicaid, and offers security for federal officials, while extending various expiring programs.

The bill is in the Senate and has been placed on the Senate Calendar (PCS). It is a continuing resolution (CR) and is currently in the legislative process as a Senate bill (S.2882). A related House bill, HR5450, is also proposing similar provisions.

answers.1:
This bill, known as the Government Shutdown Prevention Act of 2025, provides automatic continuing appropriations at 94% of the previous fiscal year's funding level for an initial 90-day period to prevent a government shutdown. After that, the funding is reduced by 1% every subsequent 90-day period until regular appropriations legislation is enacted.

The bill is in the Senate, where it was introduced and is currently under consideration by the Senate Appropriations Committee.
